ground_truth: A guy walks onto the stage. He's around 60 and tanned with white hair. He smiles at his adoring fans. Even Carl smiles and claps. Carl holds up his hand expectantly and then nods knowingly. Everyone else claps. He glances around. A spotlight picks Carl out. Carl smiles awkwardly. The audience points at him. Terrance slips off his shoes and sprints down the aisle. He reaches Carl and grabs a chair. He sits facing Carl. Someone gives him a mic. Nick waves. Carl takes a sharp breath. He presses the mic against Carl's nose. Terrance lowers the mic and edges closer to Carl, who inches backwards. He hits Carl with the mic. Carl furrows his brow. Transfixed, Carl stares at him. Terrance stands and yanks him up. Terrance throws Carl down. Nick catches him. His eyes bulging, Terrance raises his arms in the air victoriously. He strides back down the aisle towards the stage. Carl laughs and cries alternately. He claps with the rest of the crowd. Terrance stands on the stage and raises his arms. Some of the audience stand. Nick puts his fingers in his mouth to whistle. Carl and Nick amble along outside the conference venue. A guy smiles at Carl. Carl grins and Nick heads off. Carl frowns. Carl and the vagrant guy get into Carl's car. By the door. Carl stares ahead pensively. He takes his phone out and hands it to the guy. Nick gives Carl the thumbs up and slams the car door shut. The vagrant dials on Carl's phone. They drive up a dark road into Elysian Park. The guy's on Carl's phone. Carl smiles wryly. He pulls up beside some trees. Carl takes his phone back. His brow creased, Carl reaches into his pocket. He smiles. He pulls out some bank notes. He offers the guy all his money. The guy has to yank it out of Carl's hand. Carl smiles and waggles his finger. The guy jogs off and dives through a hedge at the side of the road. Carl nods pensively, then reverses his car. He turns the car around. It splutters and stalls. Carl's walking. Carl jogs along a dark road through the park. Carrying a jerrycan, he reaches a garage. He glances over at the garage shop, which is closed. He saunters over to a pump and swipes a card in it. He takes it out and rubs it on his arm agitatedly. He swipes again. It asks if he wants credit. A scooter careers down the road and turns into the garage. Carl turns to look at the pretty dark-haired woman on the scooter. She gets off and undoes the strap on her blue helmet that has eyes painted on it.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
A man, appearing to be around the age of 60, confidently strides onto the stage. His skin is sun-kissed, giving him a tanned appearance, and his white hair shines under the bright lights. He beams a broad smile at his adoring fans, who eagerly return his warm expression. Even Carl, among the crowd, finds himself smiling and clapping enthusiastically. Carl raises his hand expectantly, then nods as if in deep understanding. The rest of the audience joins in, their applause creating a crescendo of excitement. As he surveys the crowd, a spotlight suddenly singles out Carl, leaving him caught in its glow. Carl responds with an awkward smile, clearly feeling the audience's collective gaze directed his way. 

Terrance, the man on stage, swiftly removes his shoes and dashes energetically down the aisle, heading directly towards Carl. Upon reaching him, Terrance promptly grabs a chair and positions it to face Carl. Someone from the crowd hands him a microphone, and in the midst of this unfolding spectacle, Nick waves from his seat. Carl inhales sharply as he feels the mic press against his nose. Terrance lowers the microphone, inching closer to Carl, who instinctively retreats slightly. Then, unexpectedly, Terrance taps Carl with the mic, causing Carl to furrow his brow in puzzlement. Captivated by the moment, Carl stares intently at Terrance. With a sense of purpose, Terrance stands, pulling Carl up to his feet, and then dramatically throws Carl down. Nick, acting swiftly, catches Carl, who is caught off-guard. With eyes wide open in a mix of surprise and adrenaline, Terrance raises his arms triumphantly in the air, basking in the moment of victory. He confidently strides back down the aisle, making his way towards the stage. Meanwhile, Carl alternates between laughter and tears of joy, clapping along with the rest of the audience.

As Terrance once again stands on the stage, he raises his arms to the delight of the crowd. Enthusiasm ripples through the audience, with some rising to their feet in appreciation. Nick, in the heat of the moment, places his fingers in his mouth, emitting a loud, piercing whistle. Afterwards, Carl and Nick leisurely stroll outside the bustling conference venue. A man they encounter along the way flashes a smile at Carl, which Carl returns with a grin. Nick then departs, leaving Carl behind. Carl's expression shifts to a frown momentarily. Soon after, Carl and the vagrant man find themselves seated in Carl's car parked conveniently by the door. Carl gazes pensively ahead, lost in thought. Reaching into his pocket, he retrieves his phone and hands it over to the man. Nick, before leaving, gives Carl an encouraging thumbs-up and shuts the car door with a decisive slam. The vagrant begins dialing on Carl’s phone as they drive through the enveloping darkness towards Elysian Park. During the drive, the man's voice resonates through Carl’s phone, and Carl offers a wry smile. They eventually stop beside a cluster of trees. Carl takes back his phone and, with a furrowed brow, reaches once more into his pocket. This time, his hand emerges with a handful of bank notes. Carl offers the man all his money, but the man has to pull firmly to extract it from Carl's grip. Carl waggles his finger playfully as the man jogs off, disappearing through a hedge along the roadside.

Carl, remaining in his seat, nods with a pensive demeanor before putting the car in reverse. He turns the vehicle around, but it splutters and unexpectedly stalls. Unfazed, Carl begins walking, his pace quickening into a jog along the dimly lit road weaving through the park. Carrying a jerrycan, he arrives at a garage and casts a glance at the nearby shop, now closed for the night. Undeterred, Carl saunters over to a pump, swiping a card through the reader. He removes the card and agitatedly rubs it on his arm before attempting to swipe it again. The machine prompts him with a question regarding credit. Meanwhile, a scooter speeds down the road, veering into the garage. Carl turns his head to see a strikingly attractive woman with dark hair riding it. She dismounts the scooter and carefully undoes the strap on her eye-painted blue helmet, capturing Carl's attention.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
A man, who appears to be in his sixties, confidently strides onto the stage with an air of self-assurance. His skin, kissed by the sun, takes on a deep, tanned hue, providing a striking contrast to his white hair that shines brilliantly under the glaring stage lights. He beams a broad, welcoming smile at his adoring fans, who eagerly reciprocate with warm expressions of their own. Among the crowd is Carl, who finds himself involuntarily smiling and clapping with fervor. Carl raises his hand with anticipation, nodding as if in a profound state of understanding. The rest of the audience joins in exuberantly, their applause rising to a crescendo of sheer excitement. As the man surveys the crowd, a spotlight unexpectedly focuses on Carl, capturing him in its radiant glow. Carl responds with an awkward, sheepish smile, acutely aware of the audience's collective gaze fixated upon him.

Terrance, the man commanding the stage, swiftly removes his shoes and energetically dashes down the aisle, making a direct beeline towards Carl. Upon reaching him, Terrance grabs a chair with a swift motion and positions it to face Carl. A member of the crowd hands Terrance a microphone, and amidst this unfolding spectacle, Nick waves animatedly from his seat. Carl inhales sharply, surprised as he feels the microphone lightly press against his nose. Terrance, with a deliberate motion, lowers the microphone and inches closer to Carl, who instinctively retreats ever so slightly. Then, in an unexpected move, Terrance taps Carl with the mic, causing Carl to furrow his brow in perplexity. Captivated by the intriguing moment, Carl stares intently at Terrance. With deliberate purpose and dramatic flair, Terrance stands and pulls Carl to his feet, only to dramatically send Carl tumbling down. Swiftly, Nick acts and catches Carl, who seems utterly taken aback. With his eyes wide open, reflecting a mixture of surprise and adrenaline, Terrance raises his arms triumphantly, basking in the moment of victory, before confidently striding back down the aisle towards the welcoming stage. Meanwhile, Carl finds himself alternating between bouts of laughter and tears of joy, clapping along in cheerful unison with the rest of the audience.

As Terrance regains his position on the stage, he raises his arms high to the infectious delight of the crowd. Enthusiasm ripples through the audience, prompting several to rise to their feet in genuine appreciation. In the heat of the moment, Nick places his fingers in his mouth and emits a loud, piercing whistle that cuts through the noise. Later, Carl and Nick leisurely stroll outside the bustling conference venue. Along their path, a man flashes a broad smile at Carl, who responds with a friendly grin. After a brief exchange, Nick departs, leaving Carl momentarily alone. Carl's expression shifts to a fleeting frown. Shortly thereafter, Carl finds himself seated alongside the vagrant man in his car, which is conveniently parked near the door. Carl gazes pensively ahead, momentarily lost in his thoughts. Reaching into his pocket, he retrieves his phone and hands it over to the man. Before taking his leave, Nick gives Carl a reassuring thumbs-up and closes the car door with a decisive finality. The vagrant begins dialing on Carl's phone as they drive into the enveloping darkness towards Elysian Park. Throughout the drive, the man's voice resonates through Carl’s phone, prompting Carl to offer a wry smile. Eventually, they come to a stop beside a cluster of trees. Carl retrieves his phone and, with a furrowed brow of contemplation, reaches once more into his pocket. This time, he draws out a handful of banknotes. Carl offers the man all his money, but the man must pull firmly to extract the cash from Carl's grip. Carl waggles his finger playfully as the man jogs off, swiftly disappearing into the roadside hedge.

Remaining in his seat, Carl nods with a pensive demeanor before putting the car in reverse. He attempts to turn the vehicle around, but it splutters and unexpectedly stalls. Undeterred, Carl exits and begins walking, gradually quickening his pace into a jog along the dimly lit road weaving through the park. Carrying a jerrycan, he arrives at a nearby garage and casts a hopeful glance at the shop now closed for the night. Undeterred by the circumstances, Carl saunters over to a pump, swiping a card through the reader with determination. He removes the card and agitatedly rubs it on his arm before swiping it again with renewed hope. The machine prompts him with a question regarding credit. Meanwhile, a scooter speeds down the road, veering into the garage. Carl turns his head to see a strikingly attractive woman with dark hair expertly riding it. As she gracefully dismounts the scooter, she carefully undoes the strap on her eye-catching blue helmet, inadvertently capturing Carl's full attention.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: A man in his sixties, with a tanned complexion and white hair, confidently steps onto the stage, his eyes scanning the room filled with adoring fans. With a radiant smile, he acknowledges the audience, including Carl, who cannot help but join in the applause. Carl, feeling the excitement, raises his hand expectantly and nods as if sharing an inside joke, while the rest of the crowd enthusiastically claps along. He takes a moment to scan the crowd, and a spotlight suddenly singles out Carl. A bit taken aback, Carl offers an awkward smile as the audience directs their attention to him. Seizing the moment, Terrance stealthily removes his shoes and bolts down the aisle toward Carl with swift precision. Upon reaching Carl, Terrance firmly grabs a chair and positions it to face him. A microphone is handed to Terrance, and as Nick waves from afar, Carl draws a sharp breath, feeling the tension build. Terrance playfully presses the microphone against Carl's nose, causing Carl to pull his head back slightly in surprise. With a mischievous grin, Terrance lowers the mic and leans in closer, prompting Carl to instinctively inch backward. In a lighthearted manner, Terrance taps Carl with the microphone, prompting Carl to furrow his brow in mock annoyance yet captivated by the act. Mesmerized, Carl cannot look away as Terrance springs to his feet and pulls Carl up with a spirited yank. In an unexpected twist, Terrance theatrically hurls Carl back into the waiting arms of Nick, who catches him effortlessly. Terrance's eyes widen with triumphant exuberance as he lifts both arms in victory before confidently striding back to the stage, leaving Carl and the audience in bursts of laughter and spontaneous applause. Terrance stands tall on the stage, basking in the momentum, and raises his arms high, igniting some audience members to leap to their feet. Amid the excitement, Nick stylishly pierces the air with a sharp whistle by curling his fingers inside his mouth. As the event draws to a close, Carl and Nick casually make their way outside the conference venue, where a friendly stranger flashes Carl a welcoming smile. In response, Carl grins, watching as Nick ambles away, leaving Carl momentarily puzzled and causing a frown to crease his forehead. Without hesitation, Carl climbs into his car, accompanied by the vagrant man who joins him by the door. As he sits pensively, Carl retrieves his phone, handing it to the man beside him. Offering a supportive thumbs-up, Nick firmly shuts the car door, signaling his departure. The vagrant dials a number on Carl's phone, and together they drive through the dimly lit road leading into Elysian Park. Engaged in conversation on Carl's phone, the man prompts a wry smile from Carl as he pulls the car to a halt beside a cluster of trees. Carl retrieves his phone, a crease forming across his brow as he reaches into his pocket. With a hint of generosity, he retrieves several banknotes and offers them to the man, who must exert a bit of effort to pry them from Carl's grip. Carl smiles and playfully waggles his finger, sending the man off on a jog before he disappears through the hedge lining the road. Watching him retreat, Carl nods thoughtfully before maneuvering his car in reverse. Yet, as he attempts to turn the car around, it splutters and comes to an untimely stall. Unfazed, Carl exits the car and begins to jog along the shadowy park road, clutching a jerrycan as he eventually arrives at a garage. Observing the closed shop nearby, he casually strolls over to the fuel pump and confidently swipes his card. With a hint of agitation, he removes the card and rubs it against his arm before attempting the swipe again, this time prompted to choose a credit option. Suddenly, the sound of a scooter careening down the road captures his attention, and he turns to catch sight of a pretty woman with dark hair riding gracefully as she turns into the garage. Dismounting, she skillfully unfastens the strap on her blue helmet, revealing eyes painted on it, and offers Carl a captivating glance.

A spotlight picks Carl out, a dramatic touch commonly used in performances to create a focal point. Carl smiles awkwardly, unused to being the center of attention. The audience points at him, perhaps recognizing him from something significant.

Terrance, known for his energetic presence, slips off his shoes and sprints down the aisle, a move that showcases his enthusiasm. He reaches Carl and grabs a chair with the precision of someone accustomed to stage antics. He sits facing Carl, ready for a comedic interaction. Terrance lowers the mic and edges closer to Carl, who inches backwards, playing along with the act. He hits Carl with the mic lightly, adding to the comedic skit. Carl furrows his brow, pretending confusion. Transfixed, Carl stares at him, fully engaged. Terrance stands and yanks him up, a classic routine in slapstick comedy. Terrance throws Carl down, carefully choreographed so Nick, positioned to catch him, does just that. His eyes bulging with exaggerated triumph, Terrance raises his arms in the air victoriously, mimicking a victory gesture. He strides back down the aisle towards the stage, basking in the crowd's laughter. Carl laughs and cries alternately, indicating his enjoyment of the act. He claps with the rest of the crowd, whose admiration for Terrance's performance is evident. Terrance stands on the stage and raises his arms as some of the audience stand in appreciation. Nick puts his fingers in his mouth to whistle, a sign of approval.

Carl and Nick amble along outside the conference venue, a place often used for business networking. A guy, possibly a fellow attendee, smiles at Carl, hinting at a shared accomplishment. Carl grins, knowing the significance, and Nick heads off, perhaps to attend another event. Carl frowns, thinking deeply about the evening's events. Carl and the vagrant guy, who recently moved to the city seeking better opportunities, get into Carl's car parked by the door. Carl stares ahead pensively, contemplating the spontaneity of his actions. He takes his phone out and hands it to the guy, showing trust. Nick gives Carl the thumbs up and slams the car door shut, signaling support. The vagrant dials on Carl's phone, possibly to contact someone important. They drive up a dark road into Elysian Park, named for its heavenly landscapes, where the guy's on Carl's phone making arrangements. Carl smiles wryly, aware of the unusual situation. He pulls up beside some trees, the park's signature backdrop. Carl takes his phone back, ending the call. His brow creased in thought, Carl reaches into his pocket. He smiles as he pulls out some bank notes, a gesture of goodwill. He offers the guy all his money, a generous act, and the guy has to yank it out of Carl's hand, surprised by the offer. Carl smiles and waggles his finger in a teasing gesture. The guy jogs off and dives through a hedge at the side of the road, disappearing into the night. Carl nods pensively, then reverses his car, ready to leave. He turns the car around, but it splutters and stalls, a sign of mechanical failure. Carl's walking now, unbothered by the inconvenience. Carl jogs along a dark road through the park, carrying a jerrycan, a common tool for transporting fuel. He reaches a garage, one of the few open at this hour. He glances over at the garage shop, which is closed, a routine closure for the night. He saunters over to a pump and swipes a card in it, a familiar action for refueling. He takes it out and rubs it on his arm agitatedly, trying to clean it. He swipes again, determined to get it working. It asks if he wants credit, a standard option at self-service pumps.

A scooter careers down the road and turns into the garage, attracting attention with its bright headlights. Carl turns to look at the pretty dark-haired woman on the scooter, curious about her arrival. She gets off and undoes the strap on her blue helmet that has eyes painted on it, adding a quirky charm to her appearance.

Carl grins and Nick heads off. Carl frowns. Carl and the vagrant guy get into Carl's car. By the door. Carl stares ahead pensively. He takes his phone out and hands it to the guy. She gets off and undoes the strap on her blue helmet that has eyes painted on it.

He presses the megaphone against Carl's mouth. Terrance lowers the megaphone and edges closer to Carl, who inches backwards. He hits Carl with the megaphone. Carl furrows his brow. Transfixed, Carl stares at him. Terrance stands and yanks him up. Terrance throws Carl down. Nick catches him. His eyes bulging, Terrance raises his arms in the air victoriously. His brow creased, Carl reaches into his bag. He smiles. He pulls out some coupons. He offers the guy all his money. The guy has to yank it out of Carl's hand. Carl smiles and waggles his finger. The guy jogs off and dives through a fence at the side of the path. Carl nods pensively, then reverses his bike. He turns the bike around. It splutters and stalls. Carl's walking. Carl jogs along a dark path through the grove. Carrying a backpack, he reaches a diner. He glances over at the diner window, which is closed. He saunters over to a bench and swipes a card in it. test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: A guy skips onto the stage. He's around 60 and tanned with white hair. He winks at his adoring fans. Even Carl chuckles and waves. Carl lifts his hand curiously and then winks knowingly. Everyone else waves. He peers around. A spotlight illuminates Carl. Carl waves awkwardly. The audience laughs at him. Terrance hops out of his shoes and dances down the aisle. He approaches Carl and nudges a chair. He kneels facing Carl. Someone tosses him a mic. Nick salutes. Carl inhales sharply. He jabs the mic against Carl's nose. Terrance swings the mic and inches closer to Carl, who shuffles backward. He taps Carl with the mic. Carl wrinkles his nose. Spellbound, Carl glares at him. Terrance kneels and hoists him up. Terrance twirls Carl around. Nick steadies him. His eyes sparkling, Terrance claps his hands in the air triumphantly. He waltzes back down the aisle towards the stage. Carl giggles and snickers alternately. He waves with the rest of the crowd. Terrance pirouettes on the stage and claps his hands. Some of the audience cheer. Nick snaps his fingers to whistle. Carl and Nick wander along outside the conference venue. A guy shrugs at Carl. Carl winks and Nick strolls off. Carl grimaces. Carl and the vagrant guy hop into Carl's car. By the door. Carl gazes ahead thoughtfully. He fishes his phone out and shows it to the guy. Nick gives Carl the thumbs up and shoves the car door shut. The vagrant taps on Carl's phone. They glide up a dark road into Elysian Park. The guy's talking on Carl's phone. Carl smirks wryly. He halts beside some trees. Carl takes his phone back. His brow relaxed, Carl reaches into his pocket. He chuckles. He fishes out some bank notes. He hands the guy all his money. The guy has to yank it out of Carl's grip. Carl smirks and taps his finger. The guy sprints off and leaps through a hedge at the side of the road. Carl nods thoughtfully, then rolls his car backwards. He spins the car around. It splutters and halts. Carl's wandering. Carl sprints along a dark road through the park. Carrying a jerrycan, he arrives at a garage. He peers over at the garage shop, which is closed. He strolls over to a pump and taps a card in it. He withdraws it and scratches it on his arm nervously. He taps again. It asks if he wants credit. A scooter races down the road and swerves into the garage. Carl glances at the stunning dark-haired woman on the scooter. She dismounts and releases the strap on her blue helmet that has eyes painted on it.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: A vacuum cleaner glides onto the trampoline. It's around 90 and painted with green fur. It winks at its gleeful hamburgers. Even the umbrella winks and jumps. The umbrella lifts up its antenna expectantly and then spins knowingly. Every treehouse else jumps. It scans around. A headlamp finds the umbrella out. The umbrella winks awkwardly. The orchestra points at it. A popsicle removes its gloves and dashes down the ladder. It reaches the umbrella and snatches an ottoman. It sits facing the umbrella. A telescope hands it a harmonica. A cactus spins. The umbrella inhales sharply. It presses the harmonica against the umbrella's elbow. The popsicle lowers the harmonica and edges closer to the umbrella, which scoots backwards. It slaps the umbrella with the harmonica. The umbrella wrinkles its nostril. Mesmerized, the umbrella gazes at it. The popsicle leaps up and pulls it up. The popsicle discards the umbrella downward. The cactus captures it. Its ears twitching, the popsicle elevates its guitars in the air triumphantly. It strolls back down the ladder toward the trampoline. The umbrella chuckles and moans alternately. It jumps with the rest of the orchestra. The popsicle perches on the trampoline and elevates its guitars. Some of the orchestra stand. The cactus inserts its shoelace in its teapot to whistle. The umbrella and the cactus stroll along inside the museum gallery. A vacuum cleaner winks at the umbrella. The umbrella grins and the cactus departs. The umbrella grimaces. The umbrella and the nomadic vacuum cleaner hop onto the umbrella's submarine. Beside the curtain. The umbrella stares ahead solemnly. It withdraws its clock and hands it to the vacuum cleaner. The cactus gives the umbrella the peace sign and latches the submarine curtain shut. The nomadic vacuum cleaner taps on the umbrella's clock. They drift up a dim tunnel into Hesperides Forest. The vacuum cleaner's on the umbrella's clock. The umbrella winks slyly. It halts next to some shrubs. The umbrella retracts its clock. Its nostril furrowed, the umbrella plunges into its sock. It winks. It extracts some napkins. It presents the vacuum cleaner all its ocean. The vacuum cleaner has to wrench it out of the umbrella's sock. The umbrella winks and shakes its tongue. The vacuum cleaner skips off and rolls through a grove at the edge of the tunnel. The umbrella nods thoughtfully, then steers its submarine. It rotates the submarine. It fizzes and stops. The umbrella's skipping. The umbrella jogs along a dim tunnel inside the forest. Holding a watering can, it arrives at a workshop. It peers over at the workshop bus, which is locked. It saunters over to a bucket and swipes a fish in it. It extracts it and massages it on its leaf restlessly. It swipes again. It requests if it desires gasoline. A unicycle darts down the tunnel and spirals into the workshop. The umbrella pivots to observe the elegant fair-haired cricket on the unicycle. It dismounts and unclips the thread on its purple goggles that have stars etched on them.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: A cat prances onto the patio. It's around 60 and fluffy with orange fur. It winks at its curious companions. Even Luna giggles and twirls. Luna raises her paw expectantly and then winks slyly. Everyone else giggles. It peers around. A flashlight singles Luna out. Luna winks shyly. The group waves at it. Jasper slides off his socks and darts down the path. He reaches Luna and snatches a cushion. He lounges facing Luna. Someone passes him a bell. Max bows. Luna gasps softly. He taps the bell against Luna's ear. Jasper lowers the bell and slides closer to Luna, who scoots backwards. He nudges Luna with the bell. Luna wrinkles her nose. Mesmerized, Luna gazes at it. Jasper rises and lifts it up. Jasper flips Luna over. Max catches it. Its tail twitching, Jasper raises its paws in the air triumphantly. It prances back down the path towards the patio. Luna chuckles and sighs alternately. It giggles with the rest of the group. Jasper relaxes on the patio and raises its paws. Some of the group stand. Max puts his paws in his mouth to chirp. Luna and Max trot along outside the garden gate. A dog wags its tail at Luna. Luna beams and Max trots off. Luna scowls. Luna and the stray dog leap into Luna's boat. By the gate. Luna gazes forward serenely. It paws its phone out and paws it to the dog. Max gives Luna the thumbs up and shuts the boat gate firmly. The stray taps on Luna's phone. They sail up a misty canal into Sunrise Lake. The dog's on Luna's phone. Luna grins faintly. It docks beside some reeds. Luna paws its phone back. Its whiskers twitching, Luna reaches into its satchel. It grins. It takes out some fish. It offers the dog all its snacks. The dog has to yank it out of Luna's paw. Luna grins and wiggles its whiskers. The dog bounds off and leaps through a bush at the water's edge. Luna nods serenely, then reverses its boat. It turns the boat around. It sputters and drifts. Luna's paddling. Luna jogs alongside a misty path through the park. Bearing a watering can, it arrives at a lighthouse. It peers over at the lighthouse shop, which is closed. It ambles over to a barrel and taps a card on it. It takes it out and rubs it on its tail anxiously. It taps again. It asks if it wants water. A roller skates down the path and glides into the lighthouse. Luna glances at the pretty dark-haired fox on the roller. It gets off and undoes the strap on its red helmet that has spots painted on it.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: A guy hops onto the rooftop. He's around 60 and pale with black hair. He frowns at his disinterested neighbors. Even Carl frowns and stomps. Carl waves his foot impatiently and then shakes knowingly. Everyone else stomps. He squints around. A lantern highlights Carl. Carl frowns awkwardly. The crowd cheers at him. Terrance pulls off his hat and tiptoes down the hallway. He reaches Carl and flips a sofa. He sits facing away from Carl. Someone hands him a horn. Nick nods. Carl gasps softly. He presses the horn against Carl's elbow. Terrance raises the horn and rolls closer to Carl, who shuffles backward. He taps Carl with the horn. Carl opens his mouth wide. Transfixed, Carl glares at him. Terrance hops and lifts him up. Terrance flings Carl sideways. Nick steadies him. His eyes shut tightly, Terrance crosses his arms over his chest triumphantly. He skips back down the hallway towards the rooftop. Carl giggles and shouts alternately. He stomps with the rest of the crowd. Terrance perches on the rooftop and crosses his arms. Some of the crowd jump. Nick puts his hands on his cheeks to yell. Carl and Nick stroll along outside the library. A guy frowns at Carl. Carl chuckles and Nick skips off. Carl sighs. Carl and the sleeping guy get into Carl's boat. By the water. Carl stares ahead stoically. He takes his book out and hands it to the guy. Nick gives Carl the peace sign and shuts the boat door gently. The sleeping guy scribbles on Carl's book. They sail down a narrow river into Elysian Lake. The guy's writing in Carl's book. Carl smirks wryly. He docks beside some rocks. Carl takes his book back. His eyes wide, Carl reaches into his backpack. He grins. He pulls out some marbles. He offers the guy all his marbles. The guy has to nudge them out of Carl's hand. Carl grins and taps his nose. The guy skips away and plunges through a bush at the side of the river. Carl shrugs thoughtfully, then pushes his boat off. He turns the boat around. It bounces and drifts. Carl's gliding. Carl sprints along a narrow river through the lake. Carrying a bucket, he reaches a bridge. He peers over at the bridge shop, which is closed. He ambles over to a fountain and scans a coin into it. He takes it out and tosses it in the air excitedly. He scans again. It asks if he wants water. A bicycle races down the river and rides onto the bridge. Carl turns to look at the curious dark-haired woman on the bicycle. She climbs off and fastens the buckle on her red helmet that has stars painted on it.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: A dolphin hops onto the trampoline. It's around the size of a car and painted with green stripes. It giggles at its curious seagulls. Even Bruce chuckles and waves. Bruce lifts his foot triumphantly and then spins amusingly. Everyone else waves. It scans the area. A laser beam points Bruce out. Bruce giggles clumsily. The crowd laughs at him. Nathaniel unhooks his sandals and slides along the plank. He approaches Bruce and snatches a hammock. He lounges facing Bruce. Someone hands him a megaphone. Oliver salutes. Bruce takes a deep sigh. He taps the megaphone against Bruce's elbow. Nathaniel lowers the megaphone and inches nearer to Bruce, who slides forwards. He bumps Bruce with the megaphone. Bruce wrinkles his chin. Mesmerized, Bruce gapes at him. Nathaniel leaps and hauls him up. Nathaniel tosses Bruce skyward. Oliver intercepts him. His jaw dropping, Nathaniel stretches his legs in the air triumphantly. He marches back along the plank towards the trampoline. Bruce giggles and snorts in turn. He waves with the rest of the flock. Nathaniel lounges on the trampoline and stretches his legs. Some of the guests leap. Oliver puts his elbows on his cheeks to cheer. Bruce and Oliver skip around near the circus tent. A dolphin giggles at Bruce. Bruce beams and Oliver zooms away. Bruce pouts. Bruce and the clown dolphin hop into Bruce's plane. Near the ladder. Bruce glares down solemnly. He takes his map out and shows it to the dolphin. Oliver gives Bruce the thumbs sideways and claps the plane ladder closed. The clown clicks on Bruce's map. They fly down a bright tunnel into Emerald Forest. The dolphin's on Bruce's map. Bruce giggles softly. He lands beside some bushes. Bruce takes his map back. His nose crinkled, Bruce reaches into his satchel. He giggles. He pulls out some golden coins. He shows the dolphin all his treasures. The dolphin has to nudge it out of Bruce's paw. Bruce giggles and shakes his leg. The dolphin hops away and dives into a pond at the edge of the tunnel. Bruce nods thoughtfully, then rotates his plane. He flies the plane around. It puffs and swooshes. Bruce's tumbling. Bruce swoops down a bright tunnel through the forest. Holding an umbrella, he lands at a bakery. He scans the area at the bakery porch, which is open. He glides over to a table and waves a glove at it. He takes it off and pats it on his ear hurriedly. He waves again. It asks if he needs water. A skateboard zooms up the tunnel and glides into the bakery. Bruce pivots to glance at the cheerful blonde dog on the skateboard. It hops off and unties the knot on its red scarf that has suns painted on it.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: A man, around 60, takes the stage and smiles at his fans. Carl and others clap, with Carl getting spotlighted. Terrance approaches Carl, engages him with a microphone, and then dramatically throws Carl, who’s caught by Nick. Terrance celebrates, the audience cheers, and Carl alternates between laughter and tears. Later, outside the venue, Carl and Nick part ways. Carl gets into a car with a vagrant, hands him his phone, and drives to Elysian Park. Carl offers the vagrant money, who takes it and leaves. Carl’s car stalls, prompting him to walk with a jerrycan to a garage. While he attempts to use a card at the pump, a scooter with a dark-haired woman arrives, drawing Carl’s attention.
